Course website with syllabus, readings and resources. "This course examines the rich and often problematic relationship between women and science/technology.
This course will examine the relationships between gender and science in practical terms and from theoretical perspectives. The topics to be covered will include:
* 1. The history of women?s involvement in the sciences and the contributions of social and cultural factors to the under-representation of women in science * 2. The nature of science and the belief in the objectivity of science * 3. Issues of career choices and retention * 4. Contemporary feminist critique of science * 5. Discussion about the different approaches that women take to science including differences in the questions asked, experimental approaches and interpretation."
